intro: Nardophyllum nardophyllum, commonly known as the woolly phyllium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Nardophyllum nardophyllum is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
